item.title: Working Ip ban,
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“dragonchain, post:36, topic:165652”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=224715.msg1937861#msg1937861 date=1197967153]

I hate substring. I prefer a nice StringTokenizer.

Yes, it does “fucking start after the space”.

Nah, it doesn’t

It does when you aren’t a retard. Who the fuck would want to put in two spaces, or two * before entering the name, when those two * do nothing.

No.
Say I wanted to get the text after “blah” in this String.
“lol blah lel”

I would use substring(9)
That would return “lel”.
[/quote] lol blah lel
^
Substring 13, spaces count…[/quote]
Yeah no, gtfo.

[quote=“Budda, post:35, topic:165652”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=224715.msg1937881#msg1937881 date=1197968043]

Idiot.

Yea, coming from someone who calls a method a void.

Fuck what a day I’ve had. First I crash my pushbike and take a shit load of skin off on my hip, don’t get to go to the gym, my motorbike blows a piston, now I just make the most dumbest mistake ever.

Please do find a post by me in the past six months where I have called a method a void.

What about the one I told you about on IRC and you changed it?
Let me find some logs.

Do it faggot.

And can you put an explanation about it?

Sure thing. Hes trying to compile, using your compiling method no doubt, and the compiler cannot find his “server.java”, the class with the main(String[] args) void. One way to fix this, would be putting the path to the server.java into the compiler, or moving the compiler to the right directory. So, yes it does have something to do with the compiler.

[/quote]

And I fucking explained that to you in IRC. That guy was a retard, I was making it simple for him.[/quote]
Yeah, k.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Ip ban,
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Yes exactly. Before the space before “lel” is 8. 8 + 1 = 9. Before the space in typing the name in “ipban” is 5. 5 + 1 = 6.
Dipshit
